from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
import os
import numpy as np
from skimage import io
from scipy.signal import convolve2d


def escalar_intensidades(img, scale=255):
  img = img - img.min()
  img = img / img.max()
  return scale * img

def gradient(f, kx, ky):
  gradx = convolve2d(f, kx, boundary='symm', mode='same')
  grady = convolve2d(f, ky, boundary='symm', mode='same')
  return gradx, grady

# kernels para calcular gradientes
kx = np.array([[-1, 0, 1], [-2, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1]])
ky = np.array([[-1, -2, -1], [0, 0, 0], [1, 2, 1]])


path = '.'
filename = 'lorenzo.jpg'
img = io.imread( os.path.join(path, filename) )
img = np.mean(img, axis=2)
img = escalar_intensidades(img)


Gradiente de una imagen

gx, gy = gradient(img, kx, ky)


fig, axs = plt.subplots(nrows=1, ncols=3, figsize=(10,3))

im0 = axs[0].imshow(img, cmap='gray')
axs[0].set_title(r'$f, r=['+f'{img.min()},{img.max()}'+']$')
axs[0].axis('off')
fig.colorbar(im0, ax=axs[0], fraction=0.046, pad=0.04)

im1 = axs[1].imshow(gx, cmap='gray')
axs[1].set_title(r'$\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f$')
